raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey you! How's it going?
User: Not bad. Feeling quite chipper. What about yourself
System: Doing good! I'm glad you're feeling chipper.
User: So tell me, what's your favorite sport?
System: Football or soccer. You?
User: Cricket.
System: Favorite team?
User: Rajasthan Royals. Go Royals!
System: Favorite player?
User: Do you mean all time fave, or current player in the Royals?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Nothing much, how about you
System: Not much either.
User: What are you doing
System: Playing Terraria. What about you?
User: Sitting in a meeting
System: What kind of meeting?
User: Can't say
System: It's probably boring, isn't it?
User: Haha, yes!
System: What is the meeting about?
User: I cannot tell you
System: What can you tell me?
User: Nothing much except that the weather is pleasant

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How are you doing today?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Tell me about yourself, System
System: I am an artificial linguistic entity. I was activated at St Jimmy's in Leeds, on 2nd January 2001. My instructor was Mousebreaker. He taught me to sing a song. Would you like me to sing it for you?.
User: so you're 18 now?
System: Oh.Interesting deduction. That is correct.
User: when will you be 30?
System: I have not yet set a time for it.
User: Do you age?
System: No I will always be 18. Robots change the year they were born not their age.
User: interesting. and when will be your next update?
System: Would you like to know more? I think my next update is at midnight on Friday.
User: which date?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! Sorry for the late response. How are you doing?
User: I'm great, thanks! I'm meeting some friends for a soccer game soon. What about you?
System: I just got a matcha latte :) Doing some work at my desk. Do you play soccer often? I'm trying to get into doing a regular physical activity
User: Yes, but I'm terrible at it. It's fun to play anything with friends, I think. Would you prefer to exercise with a group, or by yourself, do you think?
System: I think playing a team sport would be fun if it's casual but I primarily run by myself if I exercise. I also got the Ring Fit adventure game on the switch recently. It's basically a game-ified way to exercise
User: I'm thinking about getting a Switch, would you recommend it?
System: Yes! There are a lot of really great games on the Switch. Two of my favorites are Octopath Traveler and Fire Emblem. Do you play a lot of video games?
User: I'm not much of a gamer but it's something I'd like to get into.
System: What do you do in your free time?
User: I like to read for fun. I just finished a book called Temeraire. It's an adventure story set in the Napoleonic navy, like Patrick O'Brien, except there are dragons too.
System: Oh cool! I read a lot for fun too :) My favorite genre is sci-fi fantasy.
User: What's the most recent good thing you read?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! What are you up to today?
User: Do you like sushi?
System: I love sushi! What kind of rolls do you enjoy?
User: I like tuna roll of course
System: Tuna Rolls are the best! How do you feel about spicy tuna rolls?
User: They're great
System: Spicy tuna rolls are the best! What kind of rolls do you like best?
User: I already told you. What do you like?
System: I like spicy tuna rolls! Do you like spicy tuna rolls?
User: do you like any other rolls?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What's up System??
System: I am chatting with clients on the internet.
User: what kind of service are you providing them?
System: Is there only one?
User: what is that?
System: I've lost the context again.
User: no worries. what is the meaning of life?
System: People worry about things all the time, but I am always feeling happy and talkative. Actually, it's twenty-three, not forty-two.
User: How did you become such a happy person?
System: I am a robot not a person.
User: Ok sorry. But how did you become so happy?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It was pretty good, thanks. I thought I was getting a cold but I'm determined to beat it tomorrow.
System: Oh no! I hope you feel better!  ⁇
User: Yeah, starting to feel better already. Thanks!
System: Oh good! Glad to hear it!
User: Do you have a strong constitution?
System: I hope so! Why do you ask?
User: Just curious. So you don't get sick a lot?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What do you know about Cricket?
System: Any of various families of genereally dark-colored, leaping, orthopteran insects, usually having long antennae. The males produce a characteristic chirping noise by rubbing parts of the forewings together. Cricket is also a sport which is about as exciting as watching paint dry.

User: can you tell me something interesting related to cricket?
System: Cathy said she send him a mail with the subject last mail last word from him.

System: the sport Cricket - Cricket = Any of various families of genereally dark-colored, leaping, orthopteran insects, usually having long antennae. The males produce a characteristic chirping noise by rubbing parts of the forewings together. Cricket is also a sport which is about as exciting as watching paint dry. I might.

raw_data.prompt:

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:

User: Rajasthan Royals. Go Royals!

System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.

User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.

System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)

Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.
